project.teaser: The aim of the SPES project is to generate new knowledge and evidence about the nexus between economic growth, human flourishing and sustainability, contributing to the creation and uptake of a novel integrated framework fostering the transition towards the sustainable human...
project.objective: The aim of the SPES project is to generate new knowledge and evidence about the nexus between economic growth, human flourishing and sustainability, contributing to the creation and uptake of a novel integrated framework fostering the transition towards the sustainable human development in European countries and regions. The SPES project focusing its attention, both theoretically and empirically, on the four pillars of the sustainable human development: a) Productivity, conceived as pursuing an efficient use of economic, human and natural resources through innovation processes; b) Equality for all, conceived as fostering equal political, economic, social and cultural opportunities; c) Sustainability, conceived as promoting climate change mitigation and adaptation and ensuring the protection, restoration and improvement of the environment; d) Participation and empowerment, conceived as enabling citizens, social groups and communities to be active agents of their future. Focusing on these four pillars allows both an in-depth analysis of their synergies and trade-offs, and their contribution to transition performances across Europe and the Global South. SPES will combine diverse methods, including 1) econometric analysis, including microsimulation and panel data analysis; 2) co-design workshops with key stakeholders; 3) scenario analysis; 4) case-study analysis The strong involvement of a carefully structured International Stakeholder Committee and of a Scientific Advisory Board, as well as the adoption of tailored communication, dissemination and impact Strategies, will decisively contribute to foster SPES impact. The newly produced policy and measurement framework will give further strengths to the transition towards sustainable human development by informing both the public debate and the implementation of existing policy frameworks, with a particular focus on the 2030 Agenda, the European Green Deal and the Just Transition Mechanisms, and the NextGeneration EU.
project.title: Sustainability Performances, Evidence and Scenarios
project.keywords: Sustainable Human Development, Development indicators, Sustainability transition, Inclusive growth, Post-pandemic recovery, Just transition, Social progress, 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development

article.title: Towards well-being for all in a time of uncertainty
Following the natural path to boosting city dwellers’ health and well-being
Exploring digital health solutions for the elderly living with chronic illness
Advancing knowledge on achieving both sustainable resource use and people’s well-being
Exploring how not to be lonely in the city, the natural way
Building Europe a more resilient workforce, one policy at a time
Investigating the sociocultural dynamics of well being and mental health
The way to sustainable well-being in a Dutch neighbourhood
Promoting healthy working environments for small businesses

article.teaser: It is not just about economic growth. A policy paper provides guidance on how to help Europe achieve sustainable well-being for citizens.

article.title: The connection between economic growth, human flourishing and sustainability

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SPES (Sustainability Performances, Evidence and Scenarios)
result.teaser: A growing consensus recognizes that economic growth does not inherently lead to social inclusion and environmental sustainability. Economic, social, and environmental policies in Europe are progressively characterized by a commitment to sustainable and inclusive growth...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Policy briefing on the nexus between growth process and the sustainability transition
result.description: Policy briefings on main policy implications deriving from the nexus between growth processes and the sustainability transition

result.title: SPES Website
result.description: Multilingual and accessible website to give a comprehensive presentation of the project, offering information about goals and management structure, activities, and events, as well as academic and non-academic outputs as the project progresses (incl. working papers, policy briefings, etc.).

result.title: Working paper on the SPES theoretical and analytical framework
result.description: Working paper (open access) on the SPES advanced and robust theoretical and analytical framework to guide research activities and policy engagement, based on critiques of the mainstream approaches to place economic growth and human progress within social and environmental boundaries

result.title: Report on mapping indicators and composite indices relevant to measure transition performance
result.description: Research report on a overview of (i) indicator selection practices of existing measurement frameworks and of (ii) indicators that might be relevant to be included in a new dashboard structured according the four pillars of sustainable human development and are suitable to serve as individual items for a composite index.

result.title: Updated policy mapping on sustainability transition
result.description: Research report on an updated mapping of the main European and global policies/initiative fostering a sustainability transition, representing the setting in which the project's research activities are embedded and its target in terms of policy impact.

result.title: Report on mapping, harmonising and integrating novel data sources for research purposes
result.description: Research report providing an evaluation of complex and novel data sources and associated methods that can be repurposed for the development of innovative measurement framework and advancing an appropriate harmonization and integration strategy of both existing and new data sources.

category.title: sustainability sciences
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/sustainability sciences

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
